newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish Life mulls intervention in sales row.
newsitem.headline: Irish Life mulls intervention in sales row.

text.p: Irish Life Plc said on Wednesday that it was carefully examining a request to allow the Employer Labour Conference to become involved in a dispute between the company and its field sales force.
The request followed a meeting of staff in the chief office branch of the MSF union on Tuesday to consider the ongoing dispute.
The Manufacturing, Science, Finance Union (MSF) represents the majority of the sales force.

The meeting called on both sides to the dispute to allow the Employer Labour Conference to become involved in the issue and to make a binding decision which both sides would accept as a settlement of the matter.

"The company acknowledges it is intended as a constructive attempt to achieve a settlement to the dispute. The company expects to make a formal response to the request on Friday," Irish Life said in a statement.

The life assurance and investment company suspended most of its field sales force in February, after failing to solve a 15-month old dispute over new work practices. Further attempts to resolve the dispute have also failed.
